emerging_technologies.name: AI-Driven Smart Contracts
emerging_technologies.description: Smart contracts that can adapt their terms in real-time based on external data and AI analysis.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Reduces need for intermediaries, increases transparency, but raises concerns about AI bias and contract fairness.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Regulatory acceptance, technological trust, and the need for dynamic contract management.

emerging_technologies.name: Decentralized AI Governance
emerging_technologies.description: AI models where governance is distributed through tokenized voting mechanisms.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Empowers communities, but could lead to governance fragmentation.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Community engagement, scalability of blockchain, and trust in decentralized systems.

emerging_technologies.name: Tokenized Space Resources
emerging_technologies.description: Tokenization of resources mined from space, enabling fractional ownership and trading.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Opens up space exploration to broader investment, but brings up legal and ethical issues regarding space property rights.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Legislation on space resources, technological feasibility of mining, and global consensus.

emerging_technologies.name: Decentralized Autonomous Transport Networks (DATN)
emerging_technologies.description: Network of autonomous vehicles managed by decentralized algorithms and blockchain for route optimization and payment.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Improves traffic flow, reduces accidents, but challenges traditional transport regulation.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Urban infrastructure readiness, regulatory approval, and public acceptance of autonomous tech.

emerging_technologies.name: Neural Interface Identity Markets
emerging_technologies.description: Markets where individuals can buy, sell, or lease parts of their cognitive data securely stored and verified through blockchain.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Enhances personal data control but raises privacy concerns and potential for data exploitation.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Privacy laws, technological advancements in neural interfaces, and societal views on cognitive data sharing.

mainstream_technologies.name: Decentralized Energy Markets
mainstream_technologies.description: Markets where energy can be traded peer-to-peer using blockchain technology.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: Widely adopted in regions with supportive renewable energy policies, facing regulatory challenges elsewhere.

mainstream_technologies.name: Tokenized AI Models
mainstream_technologies.description: AI models where ownership and usage rights are represented by tokens, allowing for decentralized AI development.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: Gaining traction in tech communities, with major companies beginning to explore applications.

epoch_themes.description: An era marked by a shift towards decentralized systems in governance, technology, and economy.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Promotes inclusivity and reduces central control but complicates oversight and accountability.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Increased push for data sovereignty, rise in DAOs, and a growing movement towards sustainable and equitable technology distribution.
